results.title: Nfbc Childrens Animation Collection No 1
results.brief_description: 1. “Log Driver’s Waltz”; 2. “The Lion and the Mouse”; 3. “Mr Frog went a-courting”; 4. “I know an old lady who swallowed a fly” (sung by Burl Ives) 5. “The Great Toy Robbery”; 6. “The Tender Tale of Cinderella Penguin”; 7. “Evolution”; 8. “The Treasure of the Grotoceans”.

results.title: Nfbc Animation Collection No 1
results.brief_description: Lady Fishbourne’s Complete Guide To Better Table Manners (1976, 5 min.): A humorous film illustrating the curious etiquette of Lady Fishbourne. “E” (1981, 6 min.): A political satire about how a dictator imposes his delusions on society. “The Men in the Park” (1971, 6 min.): A study in black pencil animation. “Balablok” (1972, 6 min.): A human comedy about man’s propensity to use violence. “Beginnings” (1980,8min):A view of the universe. “Cosmic Zoom” (1968,8min): Shows the magnitude of space, and minuteness of matter. “Blowhard” (1978,9min): The business venture, Consolidated Oragons. “The Energy Carol” (1975,10min): The basics of energy. “Getting Started” (1977,12min): Distractions delay the pianist. “The Sand Castle” (1977,13min) - Sculptures from the sand.

results.title: NFB Animation classics
results.brief_description: A selection of seven prize winning films reflecting a range of subjects and techniques that established the National Film Board’s reputation in the field of animation. 1.’Begone Dull Care’ (Norman McLaren 7 mins) Jazz music performed by the Oscar Peterson Trio is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes. 2.’The Street’ (Caroline Leaf 10mins) Draws on the experiences of a young boy growing up in the Jewish section of Montreal. 3.’Special Delivery’ (John Weldon and Eunice Macaulay 7 mins) A series of misadventures stretches the imagination to its limits in this detective/soap opera. ‘The Metamorphosis of Mr Samsa’ (Caroline Leaf 9 mins) Communicates through images of sand and sound what Franz Kafka expressed through words. ‘The Big Snit’ (Richard Condie 9 mins) Compares the struggle of a domestic row to the conflict of a nuclear holocaust. ‘Paradise’ (Ishu Patel 15 mins) A Divine Bird performs a magical dance for an adoring Emperor. ‘The Cat came back’ (Cordell Barker 7 mins) Mr Johnson becomes increasingly manic as he tries to get rid of a yellow cat.

results.title: Newsreel Nostalgia
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of nine Cinesound Review and Movietone News newsreels. A history of the newsreel industry in Australia from its beginnings in 1908 up to its demise due to television. The newsreels in this compilation range from the opening of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Phar Lap, Damien Parer’s 1942 ‘Kokoda Frontline’, Miss Australia finalists 1945, the Petrov affair, to the Beatles tour in Australia.

results.title: Newspaper story
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the production of a of newspaper, following a human interest story from the moment a reporter first learns about it, until it appears in print on the front page. Illustrates the skills and duties of the various workers ranging from journalists, editors, copywriters and proof readers to typesetters and technicians. Shows the huge presses and mechanical devices used to produce the daily newspaper. A valuable insight into the printing techniques that were used in the middle of the 20th century.

results.title: Newspaper layout
results.brief_description: Presents the fundamental principles of newspaper layout to improve readability. Focuses on the following four areas: harmonious layout and eye appealing balance; effective use of white space; accenting hot spots; and eliminating ornamentation. Provides tips such as removing zig-zag meandering type, writing crisp sentences, selecting and cropping photographs and recommendations on font type and size.

results.title: News story
results.creator_credit: Gerard Bryant, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park
results.brief_description: How an issue of one of Britain’s major newspapers is produced, from the early morning, as a reporter interviews dockers about a strike, to well into the night when the freshly printed bundles are loaded on to the trains. At the Guardian’s London Office, all sections are seen making their particular contributions towards the daily miracle of another issue.

results.title: News review of 1949
results.brief_description: A record of international events that shaped the news in 1949. WEATHER ON RAMPAGE shows the blizzard that paralyzed America’s northwest and the hurricane that hit Florida. COLD WAR reports that the Berlin blockade of goods by Russia finally ends. EARTHQUAKE shows the devastation caused by an earthquake in Ecuador which killed thousands. RIOT! captures the violence that was triggered at the Paul Robeson concert by protestors opposing Robeson’s political beliefs. DISASTER reports on the devastating loss of lives when the ‘Noronic’ lake steamer erupted in flames at Toronto pier. REDS ON TRIAL shows the 5 year sentencing of U.S. communist leaders. TRUMAN AT U.N. delivers a speech advocating the control of atomic energy by the U.N. prior to the laying of the cornerstone of the United Nations headquarters. Narrated by Hugh James.

results.title: News Review No. 1
results.creator_credit: American and Allied Newsreels and United Films
results.brief_description: Significant events from the first 18 months of America’s participation in WWII - the mobilisation of industry, training of volunteers, and the worldwide deployment of American troops. Includes footage of the naval war in the Pacific, the Japanese threat to Australia and the battles of the Coral Sea, Midway, Guadalcanal, Solomons and Papua.
